bibl.title: Dispatch from W. H. Randall to Frederick W. Seward, May 11, 1878
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p:
United States Consulate at Sierra Leone
May 11th 1878

Mr W. H. Randall
to Department of State
Notifying intended absence of consul on account of health and asking approval. Consulate left in charge of Mr. John Broadhurst.

United States Consulate
Sierra Leone
11th May 1878

My health necessitating a temporary change of climate I beg leave respectfully to notify my intention of leaving the consulate in charge of my partner Mr John Broadhurst in the absence of the Vice Consul Mr James Frame.
Trusting this will as in previous instances meet with the approval of the department of state, and hoping to return and resume my official in about four months

I have the honor to remain
Sir
Your most obedt servant
W H Randall
U.S. Consul
div1.fw:
The Honorable F. W. Seward
Assistant Secretary of State
